measured_by: 7-point ratings on the adjectives competent, intelligent, rational (averaged into a composite score)
justification: Participants "rated both players on the adjectives competent, intelligent, and rational… ratings were reliable… [and] were therefore averaged to form composite scores of competence."

measured_by: 7-point ratings on the adjectives moral, benevolent, principled (averaged into a composite score)
justification: The same passage notes that players were also rated on "the adjectives moral, benevolent, and principled," which were averaged to create a morality scale.

measured_by: difference between average self-ratings and average ratings of the average other
justification: Self-enhancement was "conceptualized and measured as a difference in mean level… computed as the difference between average self-ratings and average ratings of the average other."

measured_by: correlation between self-ratings and ratings of others across items
justification: Social projection was operationalized as "the correlation between self-ratings and other ratings over respondents" (i.e., covariation across items).

measured_by: single 7-point power rating for each player role
justification: Participants "attributed a… power advantage" and later "rated power on 7-point scales," indicating power was measured with a 7-point scale item.
In discussing the power game, the authors note that respondents "considered row to be happier… on 7-point scales," showing happiness was assessed with a 7-point rating.
